original: Körling, Sven Holger, musikdirektör, Göteborg, f. 27/1/79 i Ystad av musikdir. August K. o. Sofie Dahlberg. G. 07 m. Anna Lisa Lindholm. Barn: Ann-Sofi f. 08, d. 39, Sven Arne 11, civ.-ing. — Lärovrstud., org:-, musiklär:- o. ’kyrko^sång :ex. v. musikkons. i Sthlm 01. Kantor o. klockare v. Kristine kyrka i Gbg 05, organist o. kantor där sed. 17, musiklär. v. Gbgs ö. realsk. 07-13, v. Sigrid Rude-becks sk. o. Gbgs flickgymn. 09-46, v. Gbgs h. real 13-42. Förste förb:dirig. i Västergötl. sångarförb. 09-14, i Gbgs o. Boh. 1. ditO’ 23-31. Komp. o. tons.: Tre sånger. Tre dikter (av Anders Österling), kör. De svenske. Fäderna, Det var en dag (K. G. Ossiannilsson), En visa (Ekelund), Sju blomvisor (S. Dahiiöf), Fyrtio barnvisor (Anna M. Roo’s), En liten visbok, Traskvisa o. a. visor f. barn. Dikt o. ton (tills. m. B. Anrep-Nordin 34), En saga om sången (39) m. fl. RVO, PatrGM.
translated: Körling, Sven Holger, music director, Gothenburg, b. 27/1/79 in Ystad, son of music director August K. and Sofie Dahlberg. Married in 1907 to Anna Lisa Lindholm. Children: Ann-Sofi b. 1908, d. 1939, Sven Arne b. 1911, civil engineer. - Apprentice studies, organ- and music teacher: graduate of the Royal College of Music in Stockholm in 1901. Kantor and sexton at Kristine Church in Gothenburg in 1905, organist and kantor there since 1917, music teacher at Gothenburg's East Secondary School from 1907-1913, at Sigrid Rudebeck's School and Gothenburg Girls' Gymnasium from 1909-1946, at Gothenburg's High School from 1913-1942. First conductor of the Västergötland Singers' Union from 1909-1914, and of the Gothenburg and Bohuslag Federation from 1923-1931. Composer and arranger: Three songs, Three poems (by Anders Österling), choir. The Swedes. The Forefathers, It was a day (K. G. Ossiannilsson), A song (Ekelund), Seven flower songs (S. Dahlbof), Forty children's songs (Anna M. Roo's), A little songbook, Walking song and other songs for children. Poetry and music (together with B. Anrep-Nordin in 1934), A tale about singing (1939) and others. Received the Royal Order of Vasa, Patriotic Society of the Swedish Order of Freemasons.
